subject: Constitution of the 3 CGMs Committee for negotiation and One Time Amicable Settlement of disputes/ claims pertaining to toll collection of various Public Funded Toll Plazas.
text: HR4 wety TTTf qferarot 34 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (ev WRae7 & Tajtf 441rT4) 4748 _ Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 0-5 Qa 6, 0727-10, #RavT, #frt-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11014/11/2016-HR-I Dated: 03.03.2017 Policy Circulag: (1Z.5,.76/201Z) Decision taken on file No. NHAI/ 13013/C0/16-17) Sub: Constitutlon of the 3 CGMs Committee for negotiation and One  Time Amicable Settlement of disputes/ claims pertaining to toll collection of various Public Funded Toll Plazas. Vide NHAI Policy Circular No. 1 50/2014 dated 09.10.2014, the powers relating to various issues under commercial operations have been delegated to CGMRO. Once these disputes/claims are not settled at RO level, the Toll Contractors of public funded Toll Plazas are resorting to Arbitration: 2 In this regard, in case the issues could not be settled at RO level within its delegated power and the Toll contractor agrees to explore the possibility of amicable settlement , the Competent Authority constituted a 3 CGMs committee, comprising following Members, to attempt for  amicable settlement of  disputes/  claims of Toll contractors related to tolling/ commercial operations of Public funded Toll Plazas: a) CGM (COJ: Convener b) CGM (Fin:) c) CGM (Tech) with approval of concerned Member 3 The committee is assigned the task of negotiation and One Time Amicable Settlement of disputes/ claims pertaining to toll collection of various Public Funded Toll Plazas who would subsequently up their recommendations/ reports before Executive Committee (EC) for approval 4_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
